direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods handle the addition of options with similar control flows and state modifications.
Both methods add options with different argument requirements but similar overall behavior.
Both methods manage the addition of option-related entities (options and option groups) to the required options list.
Both methods handle option-related operations and may throw exceptions if options are not found or improperly formatted.
Both methods interact with the state of options and required options, though in different ways.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods modify the state of the Options object by adding options, which is necessary for setting up the test environment.
Adding option groups can be part of the setup for testing required options, as option groups can contain required options.
Retrieving options can be part of the test execution to verify that required options are correctly added and accessible.
Checking for the presence of options can be part of the test execution to verify the state after adding required options.
Verifying the list of required options can be part of the assertions to ensure that the required options are correctly added.
Assertions can include checking for specific options to ensure they are correctly added and accessible.
